intro: Stichorkis bicuspidata, commonly known as the two-lobed stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically brightly colored. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique floral structure and aesthetic appeal. Stichorkis bicuspidata is also noted for its ability to produce showy bracts that enhance its visual display.
